dt.t: During the summer solstice, the sun {wi}culminates{/wi} over the Tropic of Cancer in the northern hemisphere.

dt: {bc}to rise to or form a summit

dt.t: … enormous waves {it}culminated{/it} and fell with the report of thunder.

dt: {bc}to reach the highest or a climactic or decisive point

dt.t: Her long acting career {it}culminated{/it} when she won the Oscar.

dt: {bc}to bring to a head or to the highest point

et: Medieval Latin {it}culminatus{/it}, past participle of {it}culminare{/it}, from Late Latin, to crown, from Latin {it}culmin-, culmen{/it} top {ma}{mat|hill|}{/ma}
shortdef: to reach its highest altitude; also : to be directly overhead
to rise to or form a summit
to reach the highest or a climactic or decisive point
